instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.

threads.title: imac 21, 820 4668 - Turn ON but don't show image
threads.message:
Hey, 

working on 820 4668 and this one came with the problem don't turn ON! "only with first led on" 

i connect the power supply on board and i noticed that <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> get's hot! i try to replace for a new one but went wrong the component "burn" again but the machine turn's on without press power button! 

i take off the component and the machines turn on without press power button but only turn on the second led! No image and No USB activity! 

With <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> out, I already checked for other components heating but  I did not find any. <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> heat a bit but i think it's normal! 

suggestions for this ?? 

Thanks

threads.title: imac 21, 820 4668 - Turn ON but don't show image
threads.message:
Check exact voltage for <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>.
<CHIP>U6201</CHIP> can only be damaged by an overvoltage.
You can continue the repair without it, untill get the board booting.

If LE0302 is on, means almost all voltages are present; maybe excepting CPU ones.
Check on all coils.

Did you try one known good RAM module at a time, on each slot?

threads.title: imac 21, 820 4668 - Turn ON but don't show image
imac 21, 820 4668 - Turn ON but don't show image
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> = 1.193V

ALL COILS have voltage!! 

this one don't have external rams! Rams it's onboard! 

thanks

threads.title: imac 21, 820 4668 - Turn ON but don't show image
threads.message:
If you get voltage even on CPU core, then check for USB activity.
Did you connect external monitor for test?

threads.title: imac 21, 820 4668 - Turn ON but don't show image
threads.message:
Yes i check for usb activity and I assure you that it has no connectivity. already check in exernal monitor as also with original LCD! 

when i turn on the motherboard with only DC power supply only consume 0.6A .. already try to boot in bypass but same history no usb activity! 

It's not the first time this happens to me in this model. usually only needs to replace <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> and solve the problem! but this one no! =( 

you have more ideas ?? thanks

threads.title: imac 21, 820 4668 - Turn ON but don't show image
threads.message:
You can leave <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> unsoldered, untill get the board booting.
You can also remove <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>, just in case.

<CHIP>U6201</CHIP> is directly connected to PCH.
I hope you are not in the worst scenario...

threads.title: imac 21, 820 4668 - Turn ON but don't show image
threads.message:
hey, 

without <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> this board don't turn on! only turn on the first led! 

Could it be bios problem?  i think, I will assume as a processor problem!!

threads.title: imac 21, 820 4668 - Turn ON but don't show image
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6200</CHIP> is only power supply for the audio codec.
Something else happened to block the start sequence.

As I mentioned before, could be PCH issue...

threads.title: imac 21, 820 4668 - Turn ON but don't show image
threads.message:
Thank you Mr.Vali ! i agree with you.. i hate this new models with PCH integrated in CPU! If the PCH was separated off CPU i can easily replace for a new one.. but this processors are the only ones i don't know to remove without bent! 

You can close this post 

Best regards
